messages.content: "If you elect me to Parliament on 8th June, I will continue to be your strong voice in Parliament and stand up for your interests." - Colleen Fletcher

messages.title: Vote for Colleen Fletcher
messages.content: This General Election is a clear choice between a Labour Party who will stand up for you and a Tory Party who are failing working people. The Tories are taking the country backwards. They have pushed our public services into crisis. Our NHS and social care face a state of emergency, while our local schools face funding cuts of £545 per pupil. This general election can be the chance for a fresh start with a Labour government. We will introduce a real Living Wage of £10 per hour. We will always give the NHS the money it needs, and we will ensure local schools get the funding they need. Labour will also invest in new affordable homes to rent and buy, building over a million new homes in five years.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Since 2010 the Council has lost almost £100m in funding. However, your Labour Council has been working hard to do what it can to protect your services and regenerate the city.
Labour will introduce free school meals for all primary school children and reintroduce the Educational Maintenance Allowance.
Labour will invest in new affordable homes to rent and buy, building over a million new homes and abolish letting fees.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Offering the health and social care services people need.
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will give the NHS the funding it needs, and will take urgent action to tackle the crisis in social care.

mentions.partyLeader: Labour Leader of the Council, Cllr George Duggins

issues.brexitEurope: We will ensure that you are at the centre of our Brexit negotiations agenda as we seek a new relationship with Europe in the future.
issues.economy: We will introduce a real Living Wage of £10 per hour.

issues.health: We will always give the NHS the money it needs. ... Labour will give the NHS the funding it needs.
issues.labourEmployment: We will defend your employment rights, and take action against companies who undercut your pay and conditions. ... We will introduce a real Living Wage of £10 per hour.
issues.socialWelfare: We will ensure local schools get the funding they need. ... Labour will take urgent action to tackle the crisis in social care.
